subject: Physical Fitness
title: Why Water Matters for Performance
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Why Water Matters for Performance.

hook.text: Lose just 2% of your body weight in water and strength drops 10%. Dehydration steals performance silently.

buildup.text: Water regulates temperature, lubricates joints, transports nutrients, and removes waste products.

discovery.text: Muscles are 75% water. Even mild dehydration reduces their ability to contract and recover.

twist.text: Thirst is a late signal. By the time you feel thirsty, performance has already started declining.

climax.text: Monitoring urine color is the simplest hydration test. Pale yellow means hydrated; dark means drink more.

punchline.text: Water is your cheapest performance supplement. Drink before you're thirsty.

quiz.question: At what level of dehydration does performance begin to decline?
